FrontPageHeader: DESIGNS THAT DON’T JUST LOOK GOOD - THEY WORK GREAT.
CoilBotDescription:
This is Coilbot. He is a fun little game made for our student trip to the Netherlands. We were tasked with creating a fun interactive experience for the other students to try.

Coilbot puts on a show, wears a disguise, and will give you a variety of fun tasks to complete. (Some of the tasks require real props to complete.) Will you manage to defeat him by completing enough tasks? Fail too many, and Coilbot will be victorious.

Made in collaboration with classmates.

This project is made with:
HTML, CSS, JavaScript
ModerkagensMissionDescription:
Missions of the Placenta was my 2nd-term exam project. It’s a gamification of the most important jobs the placenta does to keep the baby safe.

The project was made for the science museum STENO’s new exhibition “The Overseen Body”. We had to make a difficult topic fun and engaging for a younger audience.

We achieved this by gamifying the topic, so we could meet our audience where their interests were when visiting a museum. We also put a strong focus on making sure it didn’t become too graphic or disturbing for young visitors. That’s why we chose an animated style.

Made in collaboration with classmates and STENO.
This project was made to fit a big screen, so to view it properly I recommend inspecting (F12) when viewing the site, and setting the resolution to 1000X1600.

This project is made with:
HTML, CSS, JavaScript
ZeroBuzzBrewDescription:
For this project, I focused on the design, 3D models of the cans, and the animation, since these were my main tasks.
We had to design a new brand and a variant of an alcohol-free beer. We came up with a range of fruity flavors, where each variant had its own unique color combinations that still represented the fruit flavors.

 To make the website feel like it was showcasing a real product, I explored Adobe Dimension to create 3D models of how the final cans would look. I also created a small animation for the hero section to show off all the flavors.

Made in collaboration with classmates.

This project is made with:
HTML, CSS, JavaScript
MusicSyncDescription:
//WORK IN PROGRESS//

This is a small passion project I am making in my spare time.
Its purpose is to help easily synchronize music from Spotify onto a music library.
There we can organize and categorize the music and transfer it back to Spotify in playlists when we need to teach dance classes.

Made in collaboration with Oliver (github: oliv0533)

This project is made with: Typescript, CSS
theOverseersVaultDescription: The Overseers Vault is a school project, where i made a webapplication. Its a DM tool, to prepare and host imersive conmpaigns. All relavent data is collected in one solution. It creates an imersive and visuelly stunning game experience, Through digital maps.

AboutMeTeaser: Keep reading to find out who I am, how I work, what I’m good at – and what keeps me busy when I’m not coding.
ABitAboutMeText:
My name is Julie Valbjørn, I’m 22 years old and based in Aarhus, where I study Multimedia Design with a focus on frontend development.

I love combining creativity with structure – bringing design and code together in ways that both work seamlessly and inspire visually.

I’m known for being reliable, collaborative, and helpful, and I thrive in team settings where ideas can be shared and developed.

At the same time, I’m both practical and enthusiastic, which means I approach challenges with energy while staying focused on finding the best solutions in practice.
Teaching: Beyond my studies, I’m passionate about dance. I not only enjoy Swing & Rock’n’Roll and West Coast Swing, but I also teach dance classes, which has given me valuable experience in communicating clearly, instructing, and standing confidently in front of larger groups.
JoinYou: I aspire to join a company where I can contribute, spread positive energy, and continue to grow professionally

ThisIsText:
Hello! Are you looking for a frontend dev with a knack for design? - You have come to the right place.

I am Julie and I might just be what you are looking for. Through my studies I have gained many nice tools and skills, but I am always up for learning more.
